Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Xenia125
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. The rooms are spacious and elegant. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. A big thank you to Mireille for being so nice to us. Hope to be back some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lars E
Reviews.Content: Small and friendly boutique hotel in good location. Good breakfast buffet, but no dinner avaiable. Friendly staff. Rather small, but modern and clean, very nice room. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well situated with extremely accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKetterick
Reviews.Content: The hotel du ministere is my first port of call for all my business trips in Paris. The hotel was recently renovated to modern and very chic standards. The choice of rooms varies but in all by Paris standards the rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The staff are always on hand to assist with taxis, internet, (power converters as I always forget!) and they are extremely welcoming each time that I return. This hotel is ideally situated between Miromesnil, Madeleine and Champs Élysée Clemencau metro stops, buses and velib stops, making getting around the city much easier. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and tourist visits to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to its website pictures”
Reviews.Author: Chinesechou
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to stay in this hotel, but I went from one disappointment to another: - room incredibly small althought I booked a DOUBLE room and paid higher price to be in bigger room. I believe I was still put in a small room. - TV not working - WIFI to low on the 5th floor to work - Heating either freezing or too hot - super small wardrobe - not very helpful staff (since there was not Room Service,only delivery proposed was Domino's pizza!)
